website_summaries.verdict: Mountable. Wide compatibility and relatively fast setup make  this a great choice for DOCSIS 3.0 broadband subscribers.
pros: Compatibility with Comcast systems means setup can take 30 minutes or less
cons: May need to be rebooted a couple of times per month
Reports of modem failing or performing intermittently after about a year

customer_reviews.title: I use this with my Time warner cable service. ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Time warner cable service. Setup was simple; unwrap and plug in. You do have to call time warner and get through their automated service and actually talk to an agent. They will ask for the make and model, serial number and mac address.
customer_reviews.author: 1Scott1

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mediacom! Good on day 1!
customer_reviews.text: It works with Mediacom and it saves you the $10 a month rental fee! Just beware if your trying to get more than a 200mbps plan get something beefier! I have the internet 100 plan and at my location I get over 130mbps on this so it works as advertised in my book. I’m an IT guy by trade so I like to think I can tell if something works well and this does so far. Time will tell on the longevity of it though. I definitely recommend anyone who doesn’t want to spend $10 a month renting to fork over the $40 and just get it. You’re saving money in four months. It’s a win win!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lightweight unit, find another
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 7 months ago and it has died. Wont reset either. One morning it stoped connecting. I really had a bad feeling about buy this lightweight modem to begin with. Im usually a fan of TP link. But Forget this product. There is absolutely no reasom for this to stop working
customer_reviews.author: RaiderSwish

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Spectrum.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install after I changed the IP address to 192.168.1.1 It was conflicting with my wireless router until I changed the IP.
customer_reviews.author: billshoff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and works great on Optimum.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on optimum network. I'm on the 200mbps plan and saw that the modem they gave me was an 8 channel down and 4 channel up just like this one. Setup was very easy. Just plug everything in and wait for all the lights. then got to the registration page on a web browser. enter your account info and it'll ask if you're replacing the modem. Just follow the instructions and it'll register and reboot this modem and you'll be good to go. I did a speed test and it was about the same as before swapped so I'm extremely pleased. that's 10 bucks a month I'll be saving and this only cost me about $40.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice...goodbye rented modem!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely super and not hard to set up. Calling Spectrum took the most time, but that was accomplished in about 10-15 minutes, and we have returned the rented modem. Don't wait years like we did! This will at least save us $10/month. Takes less that 4 months to pay for itself, and then it will save about $120/year. If it breaks in a few years, the replacement cost will be covered several times over.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Value!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TP-Link modem- last purchased was about 5 yrs. ago. And like the first one, this was a snap to install and set up and provides GREAT results. I've paired it with TRENDnet AC1900 Router to replace the second rate Spectrum modem-router that couldn't deliver consistent service across the first level of our house. This combination rocks it! So if you are looking for a reliable hi-speed modem do not hesitate to buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: JeffO

customer_reviews.title: Reliability issues
customer_reviews.text: Approximately every 48 hours, the internet would slow from it's standard ~70 Mbps to ~4 Mbps. This was on a computer wired directly to the modem. Unplugging the modem and plugging it in again would resolve the issue. I spoke to Xfinity about this, and they were adamant that the issue was not on their end. On their advice, I replaced the modem with a slightly more expensive Netgear, and have not experienced the problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know modem made such a big difference...
customer_reviews.text: Works better than my cox-supplied modem. Was losing connection with a cox wireless router (ubee brand) and actually bought this because I was buying a dual-band router (TP-Link Archer C7 AC1750). I had thought periodic service interruptions was a normal thing. It wasn't. Didn't lose connection at all after getting this modem. THEN, and this is the really interesting part... I switched back to a Cisco cox-provided telephony modem. And the problems started all over again. Switched back to this modem after that. Problem solved. No more other modems for me thanks.
customer_reviews.author: wPublicName

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed, at an incredible price
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to find any negatives about this product itself. Comcast charges $10/month to rent their equipment, so for $20, this was an easy decision. It’s already paid for itself now that I’m saving that $10 each month. It took me a while to set up but after I tried for a bit on my own, Comcast was able to help me get it set up perfectly. Right when I set it up, I was worried because my WiFi speed test said I was getting about 20mbps but after a few days, it showed a higher number. I’m typically getting over 60 through Wifi and faster speeds with a wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler A.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum
customer_reviews.text: Works with Optimum just fine no need to buy an expensive modem, save money, buy one and give your canle company back their modem and save on rental fees.. After you install, just call Your cable company with the mac number to register the modem, you fet tech support for 2 years from Tp so register with them and keep your receipt
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple of these and loved them, but this last one has had multiple issues. I called the manufacturer, and although they answer the phone and are friendly, they haven't offered to help alleviate the issues in any way. Sad.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Fast, Pays for Itself in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Owned this modem for 6 months, used it to replace the one Time Warner (Comcast) gave me, I figured that within 4 months or so this thing pays for itself, (they charge you a rental fee each month for use of their cheap modem) and so far so good. Actually it worked better than the cable companies, because it was faster. Totally reliable, easy to get working with Time Warner, you just have to call them with the details it took 5 minutes tops ....
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Nice modem, put the modem that our ISP sent us to shame...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about this modem. I was tired of the crappy quality modems that our ISP had continued to send us over the past few years, and this worked like a breeze once it was installed. We had to call the ISP to activate it because it wasn't their 'preferred' modem, but once it was up in running our speeds went up from a paltry 700K, on average, to over 4Mibs. So I can download a file, work on homework and listen to a streaming Youtube channel without the slightest burp or hiccup. Very, very happy with this purchase... :-)
customer_reviews.author: BCTolbert

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Xfinity internet
customer_reviews.text: Works great for Xfinity internet. All I had to do was hook it up, go to Xfinity through their app on my phone, and follow the instructions on the app for changing modems. This modem doesn't have WiFi, but TP-Link does have a nice wireless router for about the same price that works great as well. In 4 months this modem will have paid for itself with the $10 a month rental fee Xfinity charges for their modems.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Spaghetti

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade to maximize my cable internet speed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy upgrade to maximize my cable internet speed. I was previously still using DOCSIS 2.0 cable modem and didn't realize that this capped my speed at 11 megabits/second. No regrets on this upgrade. Getting my 30 megabits/second that I was supposed to be getting! My internet service provider never told me I needed to do this I learned this on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K Knechtly

customer_reviews.title: Add an IQrouter, and this modem is great
customer_reviews.text: As a basic Cable modem, this TC-7610 does its job of providing cable Internet service, it's a typical plug-and-play affair. On Windstream, it required calling the ISP to register the MAC address, and once they provisioned, it lit-up right away. I helped a neighbor set this up on their 25Mbps Windstream service, and we used an IQrouter (  ) they had been using previously on their DSL line, so we reset it and went back through the Initial configuration, and immediately had great quality Internet, the DSLreports speedtest bufferbloat grade was an A.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Foulkes

customer_reviews.title: A very good modem for the vast majority of people
customer_reviews.text: OK, if you have gigabit service and 15 devices connected to your wifi then this is probably not for you. But if you take a look at the service you receive and the actual burden you put on your bandwidth I think most people would be well served by this modem. We stream 4K on Amazon, 2K on Hulu and Netflix, and we have 2 computers, 2 phones and our home security system (Abode) connected to our wifi and this modem has more than enough headspace for our purposes. I can relate to the temptation to have the fastest and newest modem out there, but if your service and your use doesn't need it then what is the point?!
customer_reviews.author: Crossfit Dadoh

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: Buy this. Don’t pay $10+ per month for a horrible rented modem from the billionaire scalping companies. This works much more effectively, and way more cost effective than anything a service provider offers. I have no complaints. Tp link has done me well for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: clamson95

customer_reviews.title: Best modem I've used so far!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I did some research before purchasing a modem. TP-Link was a new company at the time I got this in 2016 and the reviews were really good so I decided to give it a try. Well I'm glad I did b/c this modem is super solid! It was affordable, has great range, transfers data REALLY fast, and is very reliable. I think it's safe to say that TP-Link is a great company. This is the best modem I've ever used and I would certainly buy more TP-Link products in the future. Would def recommend TP-Link!
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Gevry

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good modem
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for a customer on Xfinity. Setup would've been a breeze, had Xfinity not disconnected the cable from the pole at some point in the past. Connect the cable in, plug it in the wall, and call your cable provider with the MAC numbers so they can ping it, and start the service. It's that easy. My customer's got the base plan, so I can't speak on internet speed, but it easily handled the 25mbs he signed up for.
customer_reviews.author: Roamin' Roman

customer_reviews.title: Performs adequately
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be an OK modem. It looks as though it was a product return, but functions as expected and all parts that I expected were included. It doesn't seem to be any more reliable than my old single channel Motorola, which is what I was hoping for. That probably means the fault is upstream of my modem, but it is no worse than what I had before. And it was appropriately inexpensive. I would recommend this if you need an inexpensive replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MadMatt

customer_reviews.title: The first one broke after two months
customer_reviews.text: Got a replacement after the first one stopped working after two months. Fingers crossed this one keeps on trekking. It took hours and hours on the phone with overseas Comcast customer service reps and a visit from the technician to figure out what was going on. Don't count on getting technical support from TP-Link -- you can barely understand the call center. Still, a budget item!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: EZ install and works fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a techie so I really appreciated the pug and play connect with Comcast Infinity. It is much faster than the modem it replaced. It probably doesn't reach the speeds promised by Comcast but there are so many potential bottlenecks getting a signal into my house and out to the peripherals that the modem is rarely the culprit. But it is working well, computers are faster, streaming vids are seemless and TV apps run at real time speed. It seems like a real value at $40. If it poops out after a short time, I'll update.
customer_reviews.author: Graf

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about two months with 60 mbps/s speed from Xfinity and have had no problems with the modem. I have a cheap TP link router from my old internet set up and it works well with this. I am the only one who uses the internet at my apartment. No troubles with Comcast coming out to install it, and I had to have a service call from Xfinity for a different reason and they had no problem navigating around it. All in all, you save a TON on this guy instead of the Comcast provided one— I’d recommend!
customer_reviews.author: po km

customer_reviews.title: Great, fast, easy to install modem.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today to replace an old docsis 3.0 modem thats EOL had expired a year ago on Comcast/Xfinity. I held out as long as I could but recently was getting disconnected a bunch. I bought TP-Link this time around as I have had their router for a few years now and it has worked witout a hitch. This modem is nice and small, well ventilated, and worked first time. Cant ask for more than that, but I did end up getting 10Mbps more speed now when running speed tests compared to my old modem. I will update review if I have any issue in the future. So far 2 TP-Link products get 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Needed cheap modem for grandparents internet
customer_reviews.text: We needed a cheap modem for my grandparents who moved into an assisted living community. They did not need anything special and it did not need to support the fastest internet plans. This fit the bill and works beautifully. I would recommend for sure!! Normally i buy the Arris SBXXXX modems but again, this was cheaper and it didn't need to support any higher speeds for what my grandparents needed. After using both brands of modems, this one activated right away and works great!
customer_reviews.author: TheKMZ1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cable modem for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and was able to install within minutes with Comcast. At first I had problems and every day I had to re-certify the modem with Comcast. I think the problem was on the Comcast side however, because I called them to make sure they knew the modem was assigned to my account. Once they did that and restarted the modem, no problems at all for months now. One thing, it will not really stand up on it's own with cables attached, but I just throw it behind the counter anyways with all the other cables, no biggie. Works so well I bought one for my mom, great product and a cheaper price than other modems.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't like to sit or stand perfectly flat for me but ...
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the 40 bucks as it will pay itself off in 4 months of not renting a modem from the cable company. This thing is small so I'm not sure what other reviews are complaining about size wise...considerably smaller than anything your cable company will provide you with for sure. It doesn't like to sit or stand perfectly flat for me but I don't care because I don't have it out in the open (why would you? heathens) I ran a few speed checks before and after switching and this was consistently faster, slightly on d/l but it carries consistent u/l speeds much better than the Arris modem provided w my net.
customer_reviews.author: JON P DUPONT

customer_reviews.title: Great staff , plug and play
customer_reviews.text: today Comcast went home to activate the service They will work for you to update S/N or Mac address, you don't need to do anything, after the modem is activated It was also very easy to connect my TP-lInk wireless router, all took me only 10 mins to finish, Only thing i noticed is that no power on /off button on the modem... BTW, who care ???just plug it off when you need to do so 11/30/2017 update: have had it for 2 years now, all work just fine ..... It's solid product with good price Good staff, buy it to avoid modem monthly charger.... 8/23/2020 5 years passed , it still works perfectly , tank solid product....
customer_reviews.author: happy teen

customer_reviews.title: What a deal!!
customer_reviews.text: So this little guy has saved me quite a bit of money for the last 2+ years. I thought it crapped out on me recently but in fact it was my LUXUL router that gave out. I ended up going with the google wifi mesh system and I'm still saving $10/month because of this modem. I recommend this to anyone who's trying to save money on cable/internet costs.
customer_reviews.author: DMT

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in 5 months, what more do you want?
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace Comcast's $10/month fluky tower and this is a great device. Setting up was nearly as painless as you can have with Comcast - on my first call, I gave the MAC address and serial number to the tech and, of course, was disconnected just as she was sending the provisioning signal. Second call got me a tech who was surprisingly able to figure out what had happened with my first call and in 5 minutes I was up and running. She even waited to make sure my WiFi router was working. With this paying for itself in 5 months, it seems a no-brainer if you have internet-only service.
customer_reviews.author: CM10014

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of your modem rental fees
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an alternative to my massive Cox modem which cost me 10$ a month. I more than make up for its price after a couple months. This modem is much smaller than the tower Cox had me renting. The set up was really easy. I had to talk to a Cox representative to get the new modem set up on my account but over all took me 15 minutes to get this one up and running. Definitely the choice to go with if you are using Cox Cable and wan't to ditch the monthly rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: Deniz Y.

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer and reliability
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these modems and they've been solid performers 2 years going...have not had any issue or the need to power-cycle them at all. I am getting over 100Mbps on Comcast on this low-end model. Too bad their routers are not in the same league as their cable modems as far as long term reliability goes.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenpiggy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Cox subscriber here, worked perfectly out of the box. I called the 1800 number included in the self-activation sheet and the rep had no problem setting it up. As mentioned from previous reviews, if the cox rep could not find the model, mention model RTP7610 and they should be able to hook it up smoothly. So far no issues with streaming and wifi capabilities, will update for longetivity or if issues arise. Overall, I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: #thisisMelo7

customer_reviews.title: No more $10 a month rent
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a reasonable price, and have saved a bundle! It's a basic cable modem that my cable company supports. Setup is easy, only 3 wires. You need your own router since this doesn't have one built in. The hardest part of setting this up was to get the cable company to stop charging me the $10 a month for their modem after I returned it!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: this is a great value! Piece of cake to set up
customer_reviews.text: If you have a separate wireless router and only need a modem, this is a great value! Piece of cake to set up. I plugged it in, called Comcast and gave them the MAC address, they rebooted it, and we were off and running. I have the 55Mbps package and just ran speedtest.net at 70Mbps over this modem. All I needed, so this was a great price to replace my old modem that died and not pay rental fees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Modem! Works with Grande Communications!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for Grande Communications. They said they weren't sure it would work as it wasn't exactly in their list, but I was setup within minutes after calling them and no longer have to deal with any more problems from their Modem+Router combo unit. Speed is as good as before and better. There was also a few reviews mentioning more heat than the other top selling modem, but it's WAY cooler than I expected. It's like a light warmth for me so I figure the other modem has to feel like no heat for this "issue" to be mentioned so much.
customer_reviews.author: G.P.

customer_reviews.title: If you have xfinidy? There charging you 13.99 a month to use theres. It pays for itself..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Because Comcast wants 13.99 a month for a modem. Got it. It was an easy install dint need tech support. Comcast had it turned on in 5 minutes. Do yourself a favor take a picture of the info on the bottom. Your going to need it. It 12v dc. Makes it easy to power with a solar panel. Sorry im not just cheap. I dont want it to shut down. In a blackout. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: 5☆ for Amazon,  3☆ for TPLink
customer_reviews.text: While the performance of this unit has been great (6 wireless devices have not over burdened it), I cant claim to be too happy about it's quality. The modem suffered a complete breakdown in connectivity after about 3 weeks of service. I borrowed a modem from comcast as a quick troubleshoot, and sure enough, the substitute fixed the problem. I called amazon's customer service, and they had a replacement unit delivered in way under 48 hrs! It's still working fine 2 weeks later...
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie-The GreatNorthernTroll-Moore

customer_reviews.title: The people at Comcast is really dumb they even told me that this modem didn’t work ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time trying to set it up. The people at Comcast is really dumb they even told me that this modem didn’t work for prepaid internet. I literally spent like 2hr with four different agents through phone arguing that I wanted to change my old modem to this one. After all I did it my self through my ps4 and lucky I got it working. I am so amazed how much it improved. I am paying for only 20mbps and now I’m getting up to 80mbps which is insane. The size and speed in absolutely flawless. I absolutely recommend this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working just outside the return window. I purchased this brand new modem to replace a refurbished one that lasted about as long. Thought I'd be safe going with a new one but apparently not. Lasted just over a month. I'd have been better off renting through the cable company at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nalker

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I didn't get something like this YEARS ago.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is excellent. I got rid of my XFinity Triple Play, switched my phone to Ooma, and it took the XFinity guy just a few minutes to activate it. It would NOT recognize the cable connection without calling Comcast on the phone but it wasn't that much of a hassle. After taking my old modem back to Comcast and cancelling my phone service, I save about $50 a month and my internet speed test return 169 MB/s! That's crazy fast for any internet I've had yet. I did downgrade to 75 MB/s when I changed my plan but even then I got 25 Gigs of Fallout 4 down in about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: aolshove

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 2 months now and there has not been a single disconnect from the internet. This modem is definitely the cheapest 8x4 modem around and it works just as well as other expensive ones. I do not see the reason to buy them. I had the exact same thought at first, this being a Chinese made and cheap, but once using it, my thoughts changed. This is an excellent modem. The speed is constantly up to what I signed up for. Exception of a few lemons you may get, I'm sure you will not regret the decision of purchasing this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Puntable

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum, Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works with optimum. The setup was a breeze. Just had to call cablevision/Optimum and give them the MAC number while the modem is online and get them to activate it. They might say that this modem is not supported, which really means that if there is something wrong with the internet they will not be able to troubleshoot. But that is OK. Go for it and the modem will pay for itself in 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: balaji mohandas

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link DOCSIS 3.0 High Speed Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: This modem has worked flawlessly since I purchased it months ago. Replaced the very outdated modem I had been "leasing" from the cable company. I finally got my head out of the sand and bought my own modem and no longer pay the $9/month fee. Well worth the money and I should have bought one years ago. Check with your cable provider to see if you can purchase your own modem, then you can save fees as well. Pays for itself in months.
customer_reviews.author: Boomx2

customer_reviews.title: No outages and works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this modem for a couple months now and it is doing great! I haven't had any random internet outages or anything of that nature. It does get pretty warm, but that doesn't seem to be an issue for performance. At least, not yet. I wish the base was a little wider because as I was setting it up, I found myself knocking it over a lot. This is in no way a big deal, just an observation. Just sitting on my TV stand, it is perfectly fine and can stand on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I had to call their customer service when doing so only because my Internet providers are idiots. I got through right away to a helpful person (in India, I think). It has worked without issue since I set it up. The modem and router, along with 4 year warranties cost like $80 total, whereas my Internet provider was going to charge me $12.00/month to rent them to me. So I will be in the black in 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Graf

customer_reviews.title: Get the modem you need
customer_reviews.text: Started new spectrum service and used this modem. Web interface is nice and made setup easier. Works well with my tplink archer ac1750 and ubiquiti er-lite3. I have the 200 Mbps tier from spectrum and this modem gives every bit of that bandwidth. Ubiquiti router does QoS for the ac1750 and switches I have. Overkill but great performance for gaming and downloading media at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Devin V.

customer_reviews.title: Dead After 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in May 2018, died January 2019. At the time it was a sale and paid $40 for it. Looked at the warranty site and figured the time and effort to claim the warranty just isn't worth it. Good thing I was replacing my old modem and packed it away for just this sort of emergency. Should of went with the same brand as the old modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No go for Spectrum/TWC
customer_reviews.text: Tried for days to try to get the modem working with Spectrum (previously Time Warner) in the NYC area, but many different customer service reps said there ultimately seems to be an issue with the modem itself. It may well be a very good modem for those who can get it set up, but unfortunately did not work for me. Got a Netgear modem instead and that one works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem since 2016 with my Comcast connection and it has been rock solid since then for the past 4 years. My plan is still less than 343 Mbps which is the maximum speed this modem can handle, so I'll keep using this modem for as long as it can work.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Small, Great Quality Cable Modem.
customer_reviews.text: Cable Modem was easy too setup and good performance , it keep stable my wireless network not issues until today , speed also depend on your IS provider, don't spec super speed if you don't have the band wide with your service. So far Modem was stable. Great Modem for the price Industry-leading 2-year warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support so don't worry they will help you. DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem provides 8X faster download speed than DOCSIS 2.0 for an ultra-fast performance and Save Money on Monthly rental Fee.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Joohyung Lee

customer_reviews.title: Faster and saves me money
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my TWC supplied modem. I am saving 10 dollars per month by providing my own, meaning by now I have almost paid off my purchase! More than that, though, my connection was always flakey, and sometimes slow. With this modem, I am finally seeing the speeds I pay for and more. And the nightly rebooting process is not required! Pros: Saves me money Faster than my old modem More stable without rebooting or unplugging Cons: None so far
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works for Cox, but some hassle
customer_reviews.text: Was having trouble with my motorola modem from cox. Was dropping internet every 10 min. Decided to get this because of the reviews Note to Cox users: they had some trouble finding the actual modem when i called cox. But luckily to a review and question i read on here, i was able to get it registered and working perfectly by having them look under rtp 7610. Just plugged it to my computer, used internet explorer to register and activate the device and called cox to complete it. It took like 3 restrts for the modem to register. Hope that helps
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: It's a perfectly good router for MOST people
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfectly good router for MOST people. However, it does not have any routing functionality, so you cannot connect from the outside. I'm accustomed to that being a basic functionality going back forever, even in $15 DSL modems, so I was surprised that it was not capable of allowing ingress connections. I had to return this one and pay twice as much for one that could.
customer_reviews.author: J. Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after a few months, no problems or complaints. Easy install!
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problems whatsoever with this cable modem. After initial setup and contacting my cable company, this supported the new high-speed connection I was upgrading to, and allowed me to stop paying the $10/month I was being charged to rent a modem. I use Time Warner cable currently, and will look for a TP-LINK when I upgrade my connection again in a few years. Until then, I believe this will do the trick as it has already for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: MattN

customer_reviews.title: Replace your modem, now!
customer_reviews.text: I am with xfinity and I recently replaced my router modem combo with this and the TP-Link Archer. Installation was simple and instructions were clear. Particularly with Comcast where I simply login and it activates my device. My speedtest ping went down 10ms, I gained 60mbs down and about 10mbs up. If you're renting your modem/router, you're being robbed! Switch to buy now! You'll have your money's worth in a year or less.
customer_reviews.author: M.F.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Time-Warner/Spectrum 20 Mbps internet connection. Easy to get deployed on TWC's network, just had to call and give a tech the MAC address. If I ever feel like giving TWC more money, it'll support their higher speed plans as well. Mine lives in the basement, so I've never checked to see how warm it gets but it has been problem free so far (about a month).
customer_reviews.author: B. Cragg

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I had an old cable modem and finally decided to upgrade. Comcast was offering me a "free" modem that would cost me $5 every single month. Super pleased to get this for $54. Was stunned that when I installed it, my internet speed doubled. Not only is the speed good, but I have now been using it for 3 months and it is rock solid. I have it working with an Apple Airport Extreme with no problems. Great cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: basecamp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup not based on intel puma, full speed on Comcast Xfinity performace pro (burst to 120 down, 5.5 up)
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup , does not seem to suffer from the problems found in the puma chipset. I bought this to replace a Linksys 3008 and saw my direct down on Xflinity Performance Pro go from reliable 80 down and 5 up to the full 110 down and 5.5 up with bursts to 120 down. no more strange streaming or VOIP stutters.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Stern

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, but without ANY options.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says: connects to your coaxial cable and turns it into a usable Ethernet connection. The problem is that that is ALL that it does. It says the "default" IP address is 192.168.100.1. This implies that it can be changed, but it's actually fixed. You can't change the IP address. You cannot change the DHCP range or reserve IPs or anything like that. Luckily, that's what routers are for, so it's not a big loss, but still limiting factor (beware IP conflicts if this is used in a business environment!)
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Price was right and just as fast as Comcast rental modem
customer_reviews.text: With Comcast charging me 11 bucks a month for a modem this will pay for itself pretty quickly. I got it online with a quick phone call to Comcast but couldn’t get it to work with my net gear nighthawk router. I ended up unplugging everything, reseting my router to factory, plugging in the modem, wait two min, then plug in the router wait 2 min, and I was online again.
customer_reviews.author: Sleazy E

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.text: Good friend of mine recommended TP-Link and I haven't been disappointed. This was an upgrade from DocSIS 2.0 to 3.0 for me and I am enjoying the faster speed. I purchased this in a bundle with the AC1750 router and I get same speeds through to my laptop as I get to the desktop. Called my internet provider to make sure it would work before I bought it as they were not listed along with some of the other providers.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Charlton

customer_reviews.title: Reduce your bill (works for optimum)
customer_reviews.text: Works with optimum in Brooklyn NY if your wondering. Call optimum give them your Mac address and they will allow it to work. And return the leased modem. It's small then the one they give you and works just the same if not better. No lag on streaming Netflix 4k and PS4 online. Best investment I made. Had the product now over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Basim

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem and router because I got tired of paying 10$ monthly for modem rental. We've been using this modem since June (5 months now) and it works great. Set up was easy, didnt have any problems with it so far. We have high speed internet and it can definitely handle high speed internet :) P.s. we are with Xfinity
customer_reviews.author: Dasha

customer_reviews.title: It is cheap and it works with Optimum. 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap and it works with Optimum. 2 months of modem lease will pay for this little modem. Get this thing and stop giving our hard earned money to Cable Companies. Important - Optimum will need some convincing, and operator might tell you it won't work. Do you homework and don't give up, they have to turn it on allow you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Hopopotamus

customer_reviews.title: Visually appealing modem.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a DOCSIS 2.0 modem for years and recently decided to upgrade to a DOCSIS 3.0 modem for cable (Cox in my case). I found this modem works very well with my cable company's requirements and my average download and upload speeds have improved measurably. However, this modem tends to get too warm and am slightly concerned whether it will lessen its lifespan compared to my prior modem, which did not get as hot during use. Other than that, the design is more visually appealing than the ones that looks like blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Buy
customer_reviews.text: It took less than 30 minutes to get it up and running, out of the box. I activated it for my Comcast/Xfinity service via Comcast's activation page. The instructions were easy as well. My speeds are right where they should be & I use it with the TP-Link wireless router. The only issue I ran into was the shipping: there was a problem with the local post office. Yes, I would recommend this product. Yes, I would buy it again - or, if its not available - I would buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: High Speed modem?
customer_reviews.text: Good price and easy to set up. Need to call Comcast for them to activate the modem on their network. The low rating is for the following: Was not getting the 75 M speed that Xfinity claimed. So they sent one of their techs out to check. Nothing wrong with the network or the lines. The tech switch out the modem with a Xfinity modem. Xfinity modem speed was 86 M compared to the TP-link 52M. So either something wrong with the TP-link or it just does not perform.
customer_reviews.author: K. Leong

customer_reviews.title: Works well, no problems, good enough for me!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for months now and I haven't had to mess with it once! We have very simple Xfinity 150mbps in a house where 2-3 people are usually using the internet at any given time. This modem works great with our TP-Link router and if I do experience small lags streaming or gaming I simply plug my powerline adapter into the router for a wired connection and it runs smooth as can be. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Annis

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Works with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this modem to use with my new Comcast service. Plugged the Coax cable into the modem, hooked up the WAN Ethernet cable into my router and before i knew it was being redirected on my PC to activate the device on Comcast's Activation Website. Had no issues whatsoever activating this bad boy with Comcasts service. It has been running for about 10 days with no issues. Also upon running a speed test I was getting more than the advertised 75Mb/Sec advertised rates.
customer_reviews.author: Jenin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this item or the router!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! Lasted about 8 months. Started having problems..worked with Tech support for 2 weeks. Then they tell me that I have to mail it back and once they receive it they will send me a new one. No thanks. Spoke to a supervisor and they don't care about customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blessing and a curse!
customer_reviews.text: It was a good price and I was in a hurry (saw the Arris on sites for similar price later on) I guess the good/bad thing about the modem is when they put the trap on (the filter that blocks TV signals so you just get internet) the signal went crazy and the modem rebooted constantly. Lucky for me, the techs solution as it was late was to just not use the trap (free tv!). Guess if I got a jerk installer, he would say there was something wrong with the modem and I would've been out of luck. (Signals seem strong, and it's been working fine though)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and has good performance but bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this the last week of December and didn't last long. Late in February, it stopped working. The customer service sent me a new one but be prepared to a lengthy process. Also, I had to pay for shipping the defective unit to get the new one, which is added cost. Pros: Affordable. Very easy to install. Good performance ( I have Xfinity 150 Mbps and always gives this speed). Cons Very slow customer service if need them. It will take them at least more than a week to replace the defective unit and you have to pay for shipping. Broke or stopped working suddenly. Maybe, it was worth it to get a protection plan
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah alamri

customer_reviews.title: This modem has a big problem and hopefully it’s still eligible to return it
customer_reviews.text: It’ll reset every time when I start to download something or sometimes even when I open a website. The agent from tp-link said that it’s my internet’s problem. So I contacted Comcast and they send a technician over. The technician suggested I try a new modem. And I bought another Netgear modem. After I changed my modem the problem disappeared. It taught me that tp-link agents don’t know anything and don’t buy this modem again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D

customer_reviews.title: Great products works really well.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great it was easy to set up and my internet is more reliable and faster than before I pay for 100mbs but never got more than 60mps and it always would cut out now I'm getting almost 80mps and and so far it has worked consistently. Added bonus now I don't share my xfinity WiFi with my nabors.
customer_reviews.author: bryce

customer_reviews.title: Works with optimum online. When it works
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a cake with optimum online in new jersey took 5 min to connect everything. Another maybe 10 minutes on the phone. Just give them your mac address and they do the rest. Saving $10 a month in rental modem fees. Update 1 month later modem needs to be restarted otherwise i get really terrible speeds. returning a the unit.
customer_reviews.author: david o.

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS MODEM if you have Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have xfinity 'hotspot' trying to load every time I open my laptop at home. The price is perfect...a one time $55 rather than $10@month...forever... It was an easy switch, took the old Xfinity unit to the Comcast Customer Service and they switched it out and registered the TP-Link. Got home, plugged it back together and didn't even have to call to have them shoot a signal. ahh-h-h and NO more problems logging on!!
customer_reviews.author: F. Wincek

customer_reviews.title: Has already paid for itself!
customer_reviews.text: Set and forget! I never have to worry about this device and that was exactly the plan! works great with my netgear router and I can't really force a reason to change it out any time soon. Its been about a year so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ak

customer_reviews.title: Great modem to replace your rented modem
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy, from the modems stand point at least. My ISPs customer service took a bit more effort. Speed is great, better than on my rented modem. Been almost a month and no service drops, I got 2 or 3 a month with the rented modem. This is a basic modem that works better than the one your renting for 10 or 15 bucks a month, this thing will pay for itself in 3 months. Even if it dies in a year it's still cheaper to purchase a new modem than pay to rent one.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon F.

customer_reviews.title: It paid for itself after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, it's already paid for itself in the money I save from renting a crappy modern from the cable company. I will say that the instructions did not work and I'm pretty tech savvy. So I had to call my cable company to get it to recognize the modem which was a slight pain but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for my Comcast Internet. Save me from renting from them. It was installed without any problems and running reliability for the past 5 month. No need for any reboot.
customer_reviews.author: lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for far less money
customer_reviews.text: I really love the compact size and simple setup. This is way cheaper than leasing a modem/routet from the cable company. Down sides are: - web interface is super slow. - setup is super slow Up sides are: - cheap - small - runs great once setup - fast data speeds once setup
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TC-7610 modem and Mediacom cable
customer_reviews.text: I'm using the TC-7610 modem with new Mediacom (50/5 Mbps) service. The modem has been working great since installed (4 days ago). The only issue I've found so far is when you change the password for the modem, you cannot log in to the modem if you use a password longer than 8 characters. My modem has software version v1.0.1 Build 20150308 Rel62000 installed. Since the modem performs so well, I'm not going to lower the review for this. Just remember to keep the modem password 8 characters or less. I'll update the review later it I have any performance problems.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well for the first few months, then kept cutting out and now completely broken. It has a 2 year warranty that isn't worth anything because the company wants to trouble shoot a broken device - impossible !!! Very frustrating customer service. It's rubbish, don't buy it
customer_reviews.author: C. Bedingfield

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality product. Don't spend money on anything more expensive. It is paired with Medialink MLWR-AC1200 router (purchased on Amazon). Comcast is rated to 100 Mbps. Oookla speed test consistently reports 110 or higher Mbps. I did have to restart it a few hours after installation, but I think that was because the cable wasn't tight.
customer_reviews.author: KMVT

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy your own modem
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and stop paying the internet provider your hard-earned money each month to lease their modem. I got this for less than $40 and it paid for itself in just a few months. Setup was painless if you follow the instructions carefully and don't get in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects everyday!
customer_reviews.text: Missed my return window unfortunately, but I have to reset it (unplug) daily so the internet will work. I didn't have to do that with my last modem. The last one was a combo modem/router. I also have a Netgear nighthawk x65 connected. However, this also was connected to the last device with no issues. I've had my ISP provider check the lines and all is well. The common denominator was this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Woody's view

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March of 2016. Still going strong 2 years later, and I've saved about $200 in modem rental fees! Just be sure that it is compatible with your internet provider, and take the time to find out how to set it up. Some ISPs require your calling them, while others, like mine, had a way to enable it from the comfort of my own web browser. My dad bought one because it listed his internet provider in the description, but when it arrived he couldn't get it to work. His IPS's customer service told him that it is not compatible with their service and he had to get a different one, so be sure to do your homework!
customer_reviews.author: JimNC

customer_reviews.title: Absolute nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself and do not buy any of their products, no matter how affordable they appear to be. And if you do buy, do not deal with their customer service under any circumstances. Year into the product life, it died on me and I contacted customer service. Biggest mistake ever. After registering on their site, my email box was swamped with junk email. There is literally a junk email coming every few minutes that's somehow able to bypass all the filters. There is no money that's worth dealing with this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Never using cable provider modem again
customer_reviews.text: After years of relying on Bright House to provide me my hardware I finally got fed up with the crappy modem and router in one unit I'd been saddled with for four years and bought this and a standalone router. It's incredible. My speeds and throughput doubled and my up time has been solid since I turned it on and haven't needed a single reset since I first called Bright House to get it assigned to my account. Can't rate this high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jaykron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Modem never had any problem with it.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and supported by cable broadband saved modem rentals and worked perfect. Never gave problem in 2 years of use and still being used. Quality build. I also use TP link wifi USB adapters for my desktop .WIll ecommend TP link products.
customer_reviews.author: Sharmila

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative in comparison to the company's
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a cheaper alternative to the internet company's modem. It has worked great for over 2 years. It is very reliable! I havent had any connection problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannel M.

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for 30 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Great modem for 30 bucks!!!!! Beats paying 11 dollars a month for a modem...I paired this with tp-link ac1200 wireless router!!!! Works great and I’m getting great speeds =)
customer_reviews.author: Jponce

customer_reviews.title: Our place is only 820sf and it’s just me and the husband so if you have a bigger place and family definitely get a stronger modem/router but the combo I bought was perfect for our size house
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Our place is only 820sf and it’s just me and the husband so if you have a bigger place and family definitely get a stronger modem/router but the combo I bought was perfect for our size house!
customer_reviews.author: Sae Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Easy savings and easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this along with a router of the same brand (also from Amazon) to save from paying Comcast 10.00 every month forever. Works fine and see no difference between what Comcast installed and the replacement. I hate to say this but Comcast was a nice help in setting it up. Have been using for about 3 months now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Track

customer_reviews.title: The money I save
customer_reviews.text: No longer paying a rental fee through comcast. I get better speeds then before and no lag or downtime for it to update. Wish I would have done this 3 years ago
customer_reviews.author: Extremely Surprised

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up with my WOW ISP
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up with my WOW ISP. After connecting the cables, call your ISP (internet tech support) to have them provision the modem to their network. They'll ask you for the modem's MAC address, which is found on a label on the device. After they get it provisioned, if you have a separate wireless router, you may need to reboot the router to get it all sync'd up. Now I'm saving $10/month by not renting the ISP's device.
customer_reviews.author: davidfsims

customer_reviews.title: Unexplained Drop in Speed
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this modem at first, however I think I may have gotten a defective unit. The speed dropped from ~180 Mbps to about 95 Mbps after a week. An Xfiinity tech came out to check the cabling, but we were only able to restore the full speed of the connection by replacing the modem. I considered getting the same model, but decided to be safe and go with an Arris instead. For the price though, this modem performed beautifully when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

product_meta.title: TP-Link
product_meta.description: Get the most out of your cable Internet and eliminate monthly rental fees with the TC-7610 modem, certified for XFINITY from Comcast, Time Warner, Cox, Cablevision, and Bright House Networks. Stream video in HD and game online seamlessly with the high-performance modem’s 343Mbps download speed. DOCSIS 3.0 technology enhances your network’s security and creates faster throughput with an innovative channel bonding feature. Frequency Range: 108 to 1002 MHz (edge to edge) and 5 to 42MHz (edge to edge); Interface Available: 1 F-Connector (female 75 ), 1 10/100/1000 Mbps Ethernet Interface (RJ45), 1 Power Jack; Protocols Supported: Network: IP ICMP ARP, Transport: TCP UDP, Application: DHCP ToD
feature_bullets: Eliminate Rental Fee: Eliminate your cable modem monthly rental fee - Up to $120 per year
Cable Modem Only: You will also need a router to enable Wi-Fi

Faster Speed: DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem provides 8X faster download speed than DOCSIS 2.0 for an ultra-fast performance; Channel bonding of up to 8 downstream and 4 upstream channels, provide data rates up to 343Mbps for download and 143Mbps for upload

Industry Leading Support: 2-year warranty and free 24/7 technical support; J.D. Power Ranked TP-Link "Highest in Customer Satisfaction for Wireless Routers in 2017"; Great for Cable Internet plans up to 150Mbps with XFINITY from Comcast, Spectrum (Including Charter, Time Warner Cable, and Bright House Networks), Cox, Suddenlink, Mediacom, and WOW
Supports: IPv4 and IPv6 - the latest Internet standard
Eliminate your cable modem monthly rental fee
Item is CABLE MODEM ONLY. Compatible with cable internet plans up to 150Mbps*
Great for Comcast Xfinity Internet Extreme 150, TWC 100M, Cox Cable Premier, and Brighthouse 100.  Also works with other major cable operators including Charter, Cablevision, WoW and more
Channel bonding of up to 8 downstream and 4 upstream channels, provide data rates up to 343Mbps for download and 143Mbps for upload
DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem provides 8X faster download speed than DOCSIS 2.0 for an ultra-fast performance
CableLabs certified DOCSIS 3.0 backwards compatible to DOCSIS 1.0, 1.1 and 2.0 provides users comprehensive network compatibility
Supports IPv4 and IPv6 - the latest Internet standard
Industry-leading 2-year warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support

specifications.Operating System: Windows 8/Windows 7/ Windows Vista, Windows XP, Mac 10.4 or later, UNIX Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,751 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
